name: capitalize

capitalize verb
(LETTER)
Add to word list

[ T ] to write a letter of the alphabet as a capital, or to write the first letter of a word as a capital: The names of political parties are always capitalized, e.g. the Green Party.

  FINANCE to supply money to a business so that it can operate or develop, or to get enough money to do this: be capitalized at sth He said that he expected most companies that are capitalized at $500,000 or more to be listed on the stock exchange .
ACCOUNTING to include part of the money spent on equipment, buildings, etc. as an asset in your accounts each year over a period of years: We can capitalize the cost of new machinery over the next ten years. Phrasal verb
capitalize on sth
